Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: jennifer w
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice during our visit to Paris. Both stays were amazing! The service was outstanding and the location is second to none! The hotel is 1 street off the main strip and less then a block from the Arch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol1205
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very classy. I stayed there on my 50th birthday and they gave me a bottle of wine in a wooden box which had the signature of the hotel on it. They said to wait and open it when I got home. We kept the bottle for 8 years (waiting for a special time). It was outstanding! Also, I left my suitcase at home - thought it was carried out! It was sent Fed Ex from here and the manager made sure it got through customs quickly - got it in two days! Everyone who worked there was so gracious. The rooms were beautiful too! The location was outstanding - made my first trip to Paris a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Corvette8
Reviews.Content: Right next to the Arc de Triomphe is this oldfashioned and very nice little hotel. We stayed in a suite and it was a very nice stay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “French decor at it's best”
Reviews.Author: JordanT25
Reviews.Content: Our stayed at Hotel Napoleon nice and the room was very French decorated. The hotel was very close to the Arc de Triomphe. The metro was even closer. Not much shopping or cafes near by. The bar was too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great!!!”
Reviews.Author: JOOST_533
Reviews.Content: this hotel is just great!the admosphere is very elegant and the staff is really professional.the rooms are very clean and although is classified as a 4 stars hotel i think is more than a 5 stars one.they really make you feel the parigian admosphere.i reccommend this hotel for those who really want to have a taste of PARIS!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Abdulrahman4
Reviews.Content: Excellent location 2 minutes walk to Arc de Triumph and Champs Elysee . Rooms are small but spotlessly clean . The front office desk staff are rude and not friendly. i may comeback for the location and cleanness only

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that you will always come back to when in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Abdullah62
Reviews.Content: Been in Paris from 25 Jan. for three days and choose this hotel due to past satisfied experience. Excellent front desk staff and Concierge, Coffee shop and house keeping. All staff are ready to help with a big smile. Good location that you can see Paris attractions in a walking distance. good value for money. Thus, I will always recommend this hotel for Paris visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Michael1390171
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just back after a great weekend break in Paris. The Hotel was in a perfect location.It is within walking distance of all the best sights in central Paris. I should say that I will be 60 on my next birthday and I found it no problem to get to the sights. The staff were friendly and could speak good english. We did not have much interaction with the staff,but that was by choice. The room was clean, warm and nicely decorated. If I had to say something negative it would be that the room was a bit on the small size, but then again it is Paris. I would stay there again in a heart beat and I am not easily pleased. We hired Paris Shuttle to collect us from the airport and bring us back,I would recommend that service as well. It takes away all the hassle,brings you right to the Hotels front door and brings you right back to Terminal 1.It does what it says on the box.

Reviews.Title: “Among the Best for Us”
Reviews.Author: Excaper
Reviews.Content: After an overnight flight, we arrived at the hotel around 10:00am and as expected, our room wasn’t ready. We were told it would be ready around 2:00. It wasn’t. About an hour later, we were finally taken to our room. After that, everything was excellent! We booked a suite and it did not disappoint. The bedroom is wholly separated by two sliding doors and allows for complete privacy from the sitting room. The toilet is separate from the bathroom and is accessible from the hallway to the sitting room or the bathroom. Furnishings were both lovely and comfortable. The king bed was relatively comfortable and had very nice linens and four pillows. There was tea and coffee making facilities and a minibar that was restocked everyday. The suite was on the first floor above the lobby and bar. The whole time we were there we heard no noise from downstairs or from the street below when the windows were closed. There were French doors from the bedroom and from the sitting room which opened onto a huge balcony. It was furnished with enough resin wicker love seats and chairs to seat 6 people. It overlooked Ave de Friedland and the Arc de Triomphe. The first night there we were too tired to go looking for a restaurant so we ate at Bivouac Café in the hotel. It’s a beautiful space for drinks or dinner. The food, however, did not live up to the atmosphere. Neither of our meals were cooked. My husbands steak was not just rare, but raw in the middle. My salmon was also raw in the middle. None of the sides were hot. We also ordered room service a couple of times and the food was excellent. The portion sizes for breakfast (again, room service) were insane. Two breakfasts were ordered but enough food for 6 people was delivered. We gave it our best try! We were lucky enough with the weather that we were able to sit outside a couple of times and have a drink after a long day of sightseeing. The Bivouac patio has nice comfortable seating and catches the late afternoon sun. The staff was outstanding. They really took pride in their ability to provide us with anything we wanted or needed. I will say that as a Canadian, you really have to get used to the reserved nature of the French. At first it seems like they couldn’t care less about you but at our first request and attempt at speaking very poor French, they couldn’t have been more helpful. Excellent service. Maybe they felt sorry for my inability to pronounce any French word properly. We went to Normandy for 4 days and when we returned, we weren’t able to get the same suite. We were instead given an even bigger suite on the 5th floor. It had a courtyard view which was quite pretty if not as dramatic as the view in the first room. The bed was even more comfortable. The bathroom was even bigger with 2 showers. There was twice as much closet space and shelving. Both rooms were gorgeous and spacious and I really couldn’t fault either. If I were to return to Paris, I would not hesitate to book this hotel again and I would highly recommend it to anyone, especially the suites. In fact, I can’t wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MacEochaidh
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the napoleon for location, 2 mins from the arc de triomphe. 4 of us (2 and 2 kids)travelled and therefore got a suite which was perfect size wise and extremely well appointed. Some of the common areas are a little tired although there were some minor renovations going on when we were there. Prices are high, we got a great deal through a booking engine so a search is worthwhile. The prices in the restaurant and bar are equally high, although they are comparable to other parisian hotels. Overall we found it an extremely comfortable and convenient base to explore Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great room and staff”
Reviews.Author: tuna13
Reviews.Content: The location was great, staff was friendly and housekeeping was excellent. Would definitely choose this hotel in my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in top spot”
Reviews.Author: Derlee
Reviews.Content: I had booked suite in napoleon for a romantic trip and was not disappointed.. Location is, of course, great. Room was large, clean and stylish. Only negative with room was lack of storage space for clothes. Staff excellent. Very quiet despite location. Room service very good.

Reviews.Title: “Non-functional room facilities. Appalling service. Unfriendly staff. Not worth 300 euros per night.”
Reviews.Author: Silverbrim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at their so-called "Executive Double room" claimed to be 26 sqm large for four nights. Our room number was 423. The room is much much smaller than shown in picture, with one window facing a courtyard, and opposite is a commercial office building. Barely any light came through. We purchased movies on the TV being 19 euros each, but none of their films were available to our room (funny enough we were charged each time). I contacted reception to see whether they could and "would" look into it, but all we got were shrugs. This was on the first night stay and they said nothing could be done. Someone came to our room to check the TV on the forth night (our last night stay), but yet it couldn't be fixed. Disappointing from beginning to end! On the room booking description says air conditioning available, but guess what,.. it doesnt apply in winter! Our room (or more correctly the entire hotel) soared to temperatures over 26-7 degrees celcius. It was stuffy and hot. I asked reception after the first night why our room air-condition set at 20 degrees celcius did not work, and the room was still very hot. She said that when the central airconditioning (set at very warm) is on, every room air-condition unit will be off. I was appalled by this, outside temperatures were around 5 degrees so heating up the hotel lobby and corridors meant setting their system to be very warm. This included all the rooms and corridors in the hotel. Given our tiny room, the room stayed very very warm.The lady staff said the only solution for better sleep was to leave our window open - all day and night. seriously?!?! We slept in sweat in winter!!! If I haven't prepaid my four nights stay at the Hotel Napoleon, I would have left after the first night. To conclude, there was non-functional room facilities, appalling service, unfriendly staff and definitely not worth 300 euros per night. If you are willing to risk sleepless nights, then you are very welcomed to stay at the Hotel Napoleon, Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MalbuMom
Reviews.Content: Near a metro, tai stand, the Champs Elysee, and the beautiful Arc d'Triomphe, everything was easy to get to. Rooms were nice and clean. Had an upgraded room that was still a bit small but very comfortable. Friendly staff. Wireless is pricey but that is probably my only complaint. Slept very well here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Elnotre
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with my mom a week ago... Rooms are small so don't hesitate to upgrade to exclusive rooms... Great service and great location... We'll definitively go back...

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon H
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very nice, staff were very helpful and friendly, bathroom was fantastic, and breakfast was fantastic each morning. Would definitely go back again, no problems at all. The only issue we experienced was the lack of wireless internet in the rooms, which was a bit disappointing but not a major issue. Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Konstantin T
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic. Staff is polite and always ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TurkeyMarazi
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with convenient location, good scenery, but ı have some booking problems with front desk regarding my credit card, ı did not know how my card is not accepted? we solved the problem with another (third card!) card. Front desk personel and the others were friendly and helpfull, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Paris perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah B
Reviews.Content: What a great location! Very easy to get to from CDG. And the staff were very helpful. They even upgraded us to a suite! Recommended a very good restaurant in the neighborhood. Would definitely stay there again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our 3 night stay in this hotel. The location to the Champs-Élysées is brilliant. Very clean room etc. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Service, location, and quality”
Reviews.Author: Janet M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Hotel Napoleon four times since 2000. Each stay has been wonderful. The front desk personnel are welcoming, the concierge service goes out of its way to please, the bar/lounge staff are accomodating, and the porters/housekeepers are most polite and helpful. As with all real estate, location matters. Sitting outside at the Cafe Bivouac with a cigar, cognac, and view of the Arc de Triomphe was my husband's favorite memory of our September 2011 Paris trip. A main Metro stop is one block away and the Champs-Elysees another block. The rooms are comfortable and the air conditioning works (this matters to Americans!). We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied every time !!”
Reviews.Author: 1960Neerpelt
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, I've stayed there four of five times and that says it all I think because in Paris you can easily choose another place to stay because there are so many hotels. Two years ago when I stayed there they were working on a renovation of the rooms and this time I saw the result and I must say they really did a good job !! The employees working here from the door, the reception, room service, the bar are all working with a smile on their face. The location of the hotel is fantastic, you are 100 meters away from the Arc de Tromphe and the Champs Elysées. Lou / Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Location & Charm”
Reviews.Author: travelingon20
Reviews.Content: Charming and a little quirky hotel with great location. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy it- Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: clovesncinnamon
Reviews.Content: Dont know if it was Paris or the hotel, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. I had come with with my colleagues for a leisure trip and we were booked online for 3 junior suites. Checking in took some time, but we got an upgrade on one of our suites when we reached there. The decor is very elegant. The beds were very comfortable. When we got to our room in the evening, they had laid out the sofa/bed to look just like a plush queen size bed with fresh smelling linen. The toilet and bathroom were seperate- the former in the corridor to the bedroom and bath was a door from the bedroom(I dont know if many people other) There was lots of storage space, hangers, linen and a view of the ACD from our balcony. Amazing! As we were checking out, I'd realised I lost my gloves somewhere in the hotel . When we came to collect our bags later that evening, housekeeping had found them and handed them over. That was very nice of them. I have a video of the suite and corridor- not sure how I can share that. Some downsides: dingy corridors, no supermarkets and street shopping nearby

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service with exceptional value for money”
Reviews.Author: zajhbfemme
Reviews.Content: One could not ask for a more convenient location in central Paris - just steps away from the CDG Metro and literally 30 steps to the Arc de Triomph and Champs Elysses. This was especially convenient for me as I was hesitant to use the public transport by myself, and this lication allowed me to catch the hop on hop off bus from the Champs Elysses without first having to take a metro or bus to a central spot. The hotel has an old world charm, with warm and attentive staff. The check-in procedure was a breeze and even the porters were helpful with information regarding the hotel and the room. Concierge services were very efficient and helpful. I stayed in a standard room, which exceeded my expectations. One of the reasons I chose the Napoleon Hotel, apart from its location, was that the decor was authentically French and not the standard vanilla decor across many hotels (see pics and please mind the untidyness!). There was ample closet space including quaint bookshelves (filled with many good reads - a pleasant surprise!!). When you entered the room, there was a tiny "entrance hall" - see pic below, with a closet, and door to the bathroom, with a separate door leading to the bedroom. This was a nice touch to add more space to the room and to separate the bathroom from the bedroom. The bathrooms were a pleasure, especially for European standards. One can gauge that they were only just recently refitted, with modern and appealing fittings. A tip is to just tilt the showerhead a tad toward the door to avoid any water on the floor, but really that is a minor tip. A few things to bear in mind is that there is no free wifi, with 24 hour access costing you 20 euro. Also there are no tea/coffee facilities in the room, nor is room service available after midnight, so if you feel for a cup of coffee, you might have to take a short walk to one of the cafe's on the Champs which can be a bit of a schlep. The hotel does however have a wide selection of television and movie channels, with the latest movie releases available for a reasonable fee. The value for money I received was unrivalled and I would definitely return to the Napoleon Hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “BAD BAD BAD---Server stole my money!!!DON'T GO DON'T GO!!!”
Reviews.Author: Purpleveronica
Reviews.Content: Sep 29,2011 I left my wallet in my room and went out have dinner with my friends, after I came back, server took EURO100 from my wallet. Reported to manager, they checked there was one server went to my room, but they said to me "we are not take any responsibility to your money, you should put your money in the safe. what you want me to do?give your Euro100 back?" Can't believe that such a expensive hotel with poor service, and didn't respect customer at all. And I didn't stay there just one day, 2 WEEKS AND 2 ROOMS, also they are our company's hotel contractor.I WILL COMPLAIN TO MY COMPANY AND ASK THEM TO STOP THE CONTRACT.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mcgradyd
Reviews.Content: I must say from the moment I booked this hotel, all correspondence was very prompt and they couldn't have done enough. They gave us great direction by train from the airport to the Friedland exit and wow what a sight we were greeted with coming out of the exit, the Arc de Triumph .... A truely amazing taste of what to expect and over the next 4 days we were certainly not disappointed with the City! The hotel was right on the Arc de T, just stepping into the reception was pure luxury and chic. The checking in/ out was very smooth, Carlos was extremely helpful throughout our stay and nothing was a problem, again the room (107) was of a very high standard, spotless and quality, seemed to have been renovated quite recently as it was perfect. My only small/ tiny concern was, I did notice the glasses in the bar were not polished and having been brought up in the bar industry I do notice things like that but it certainly wouldn't put me off returning. Over all we couldn't fault this hotel and would highly recommend a stay at this hotel in such a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and quality place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: yaserkangani
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two nights stay with family, we loved it, comparing to many other 4 stars in Paris, this hotel is very nice. Location is superb, just few steps from beginning of Champs Elysee and Arc the Triumph, breakfast was standard with good quality, variety was not so much but I am sure you will enjoy your breakfast. Rooms are not new but they are well preserved. Room service was on time with quality food. Concierge had very good knowledge about attractions and was very helpful ( this is not something which you can find easily in 3 and 4 stars in Paris ). Reception staff were very welcoming and checking process was quite fast and smooth. Overall experience was really good specially as this hotel offers an attractive rate for its rooms. If I want to stay again in the same area, this hotel is again an option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: mkbirdwell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three night before we took the train to London and it was nice and well priced. This is a place to sleep and eat while seeing the sights in Paris. There is so much to do in the city that one spends very little time in your room. It is also located in a great part of the city that is close to many major attractions as well as the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money. Cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: brunneng
Reviews.Content: My company books the Napoleon when I work in Paris. It's close to the offices, and the feedback about the hotel is great. I understand why.. So, this is right next to the Arc de Triomphe. I think from a number of rooms you can see the monument, if you care for that. It's in one of the nice areas of Paris. Traffic can be heavy on the boulevard, but the windows don't let much noise through. What makes this hotel stand out, is that you get nicely sized rooms for your money. It's not an expensive hotel, yet the rooms and bathrooms are spacey and well appointed. They are not in a style I would fancy at home, all gold and red, but it works very well and gives the rooms an impression of luxury. Beds are comfortable, and the bath has a bathtub that is actually inviting. The staff is not remarkable, but nice and efficient enough even if something goes wrong (like, the computer is down). I'd recommend the hotel, and will return.

Reviews.Title: “never seen such a rude recepcıonıst..”
Reviews.Author: beran k
Reviews.Content: We stayed ın August 2011 ,there was a blond lady ,she was very rude towards us,the first night we stayed very good rooom but our frıends joıned us next day and they moved us to another room which had a terrible humidity smell we asked them to change and this time they put us to a room and water was comıng out ıth bath we told them to repair they said ok but never came.In the mornıng before 8 o clock ,the room servıce awakened us knockıng our rooms,we didn't want such service we were ın halıday and we wanted to sleep,when we asked them why they awakened us,they stopped cleanıng our room next day.I have never seen such a terrible hotel workwers before.Beran Kufi-Cyprus

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but no free internet!”
Reviews.Author: EddieKn
Reviews.Content: In general it is a good hotel, good location, it had a little view of arc de triomphe. rooms were fine, reception staff were kind. our main problem was the internet, it should be free, just like any other hotel, and the internet prices were very expensive! I liked the fact that they serve a welcome drink, and some sweets everyday afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lifeisgood67
Reviews.Content: Location was great as was the service. We were upgraded upon arrival to a top floor suite -- amazing views! Hotel easily accommodated our family of six with a wide age span, no small feat for a Paris Hotel. We look forward to returning to this beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Tikaku
Reviews.Content: From the arrival to the hotel (on time for the check in) my room wasn't ready (I asked for the lower floor). I went to the lobby to get a drink and to relax after the trip, the waiter brought me the menu and never came back to take an order. After waiting for 30min I left to get my drink elsewhere, I was in Paris after all! I came back at about 4.30 and my room was finally ready. The only positive point for me was the room itself, which was nicely decorated and well-appointed. I had a problem with the internet, called for help, which never showed up; luckily i resolved the issue myself. I received my room service salade niçoise, which was OK. 26 euro breakfast is very limited. And when I complained in the reception about all the services problems, they didn't offer any compensation, like include the breakfast etc. Basically, it is a hotel in a nice traditional French style, but badly needs improvement in service. For my next trip to Paris I chose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In line with other Paris hotels”
Reviews.Author: ngman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely adequate as a place to stay for a few nights, but it suffers from the same shortcomings as many properties in Paris and there are a few things the hotel could do to improve the situation: 1. Room are small - although this is something I've noticed with many hotels in Paris. My room was only slightly longer than than length of the bed. 2. The bed, while comfortable, was two single beds covered with a sheet, so on occasion, I did find myself slipping into the gap between the two beds in the middle of the night. A double mattress would have been preferable. 3. The bathroom appeared to have been recently rennovated and the shower (there was no bath) was powerful. But some sort of soap dish/bottle holder would have been useful - things could only be kept on the floor. 4. Breakfast prices and room service are criminally expensive! Breakfast was €26 for a self service buffet consisting of a few (bacon, eggs, sausages and pancakes - all laced with too much salt) hot items and a selection of charcuterie and cheeses. The room service menu listed an espresso for €7!! A bottle of Evian from the minibar was €6. Eye watering prices. 5. Note, there are no leisure facilities (gym, sauna etc) at this hotel. So, the main things for me - use a proper double mattress, drop the ridiculous prices and screw in a soap dish in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, historic hotel, wrong end of town”
Reviews.Author: fjsmithPerth
Reviews.Content: The Napoleon Hotel has had a long and interesting patronage including Orson Wells & Errol Flynn. Orson's grumpy face stared down at me each evening as I retired to bed. The hotel is lovely and well appointed - staff was always helpful and obliging. My mistake was that I chose this hotel without knowing anything about Paris and consequently, on Friday & Saturday nights, there were no bars or restaurants open nearby which meant we either had to travel (not after an exhausting day sightseeing!) or eat and drink at the hotel which was expensive. It is of course a 5* hotel so one expects to pay premium prices so I have no complaints. My only advice to those looking to stay here is that they check that the location meets their requirements. Most of the main attractions, Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notre Dame etc are at least a 40-90 minute walk!

Reviews.Title: “A "Little Engine that Could," and that Does, Wrapped Up in a Pleasant, Well Maintained, Four-Star Hotel at a Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: Influencer
Reviews.Content: Beyond its perfect location at the foot of the Arc de Triomphe and within minutes of Paris' finest restaurants and museums, what the Hotel Napoleon has going for it is a handsome lobby filled with elegant art and furniture, a host of spacious, well-appointed suites with superior views of Paris, courteous and professional service, a "little engine that could" attitude that is to be commended, all for a reasonable price (by Paris standards) when compared to other Paris hotels. Unless you sensibilities demand that you be bathed in luxury every moment, such that you must stay at a five-star hotel, this is an excellent choice for families, couples or singles.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Courteous Service - Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: SharpaPerth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a last minute scramble during a holiday season to find a hotel for the extra two days we had extended our stay by, and ended up booking on-line at Hotel Napoleon. When we arrived the check-in process was warm, courteous and very efficient. The room was small but had everything we could need and besides we were out sight-seeing all the time anyway. The first part of our trip was business related and Paris was definitely not on my list of places to go. I had expected it to be full of pretense, however I was blown away by the history, beauty and scale of the place. Hotel Napoleon just added some charm to the whole deal, with the decor and atmosphere. Clean and well-priced we will be back !

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: family188590
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, very good service of staff, very good breakfast Very nice rooms in one world excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great location and smashing service”
Reviews.Author: SmackerStortford
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a beautiful suite on arrival. Fantastic care and service. Step out of the hotel and you are pretty much at the Arc de Triomphe. Hotel advised some great restaurants for us that welcome children. A lovely ,safe, yet vibrant, area, to stay in. All round fab experience. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: KDtravel121212
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Napoleon for one night with three girlfriends and it was absolutely perfect. We shared a senior suite, and although two of us slept on the sofa bed, it was roomy and comfortable. We all had bathrobes and fluffy towels. The bedroom and living room were gorgeous. The bathroom was huge by Paris standards and had a separate shower and bathtub. The shower had both a handheld and rainshower - fantastic. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the Reception desk are very friendly. The location - a few steps from metro Charles de Gaulle Etoile and a few more steps from the l'Arc de Triomphe - was fantastic. Also, the Champs Elysees was only a two minute walk! The price was fine for four friends sharing, but I would find the hotel expensive for a family. I can only highly recommend the Hotel Napoleon - it was truly fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “We are coming back!”
Reviews.Author: GGess
Reviews.Content: Loved the location! We were surprised how close it is to the RER. The staff checking us in was friendly enough though a bit reluctant to speak English but she did so perfectly! We were surprised with an early check in and an upgrade to a suite. Our jaws dropped when we saw the suite - such luxury! Everything was wonderful and we had such good sleep. Bed was very comfortable and great bathroom. Housekeeping was very diligent every day to pull out the sofa bed in the evening and to put it away in the morning. Highly recommended. We wish to thank the management for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, great rooms and very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: chicago009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Napoleon for Spring Break and I would stay here again. I usually book the big chain hotels, but am so pleased that we tried this hotel. The room was spacious w/ a pull out bed for the kids. Decor was nice, room very clean, and a rainshower in the bath. Location can't be beat! Walk out turn to the right and you see the Arc de Triomphe. Go straight and you are on the Champs Elysees - great shopping, restaurants! Very convenient for both the hop on/hop off tourist bus and the Metro. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived early morning (9am) and they happily checked us in early so that we could rest up. Really loved our stay and highly recommend Hotel Napoleon!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: JCGConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at Hotel Napoleon Paris this week. We loved the hotel and staff. You pay for location and services at this hotel. It is literally a stone's throw from the Arc de Triomphe, which we could see from our room's small balcony over Ave Friedland , and one block over from the hustle and bustle of the Champs Elysees. We stayed in a Junior Suite Avenue room. It was a large, oversized room with a comfortable firm king size bed, side tables, 2 desks, a small round table and plenty of seating, as well as a large armoir for hanging and storing clothes. There was also a flatscreen tv but I don't think we ever turned it on. The bathroom was clean and modern. The shower worked but not the best. The tub was great though as most Europeans take baths. The room was decorated in the usual Empire decor you find around Paris. It had high ceilings, lots of crown molding and air conditioning which worked wonderfully, as it was rather warm the days we were in Paris. The staff is exceptional. There was not a single incident where any staff member was not absolutely pleasant and helpful in every way. They gave us daily updates on the strike situation when we inquired. They happily uncorked bottles of wine we bought while out and about after returning to the hotel. They even told us that rose wine is terrible at room temperature and provided a wine bucket filled with ice water for us. Just great service and with a smile. I'm sure it helped a bit that my partner can speak French fairly well. Even though the staff can speak English it's helpful if some kind of effort on your part is made. But this is true anywhere anyone travels. We got the wireless internet in our room for $20euros/nt. We brought iPhones and, while they worked and got connected, it was sometimes difficult to connect, took some time, or the connection was frequently lost. The laptop seemed to find the weak wireless signal must easier and keep connected. That being said, it worked, we were able to email and post to facebook without a problem and have fun sharing our trip with friends and family back home. :o) Please note that when we booked the trip online, we checked the internet box. When we checked in and the rates all reviewed, we were told that we opted for the daily internet charge which we agreed to. It was explained to us that the bill will likely have multiple charges for connection to the internet, since you are technically charged every time you connect, which you must do daily providing a login and pw. You are told how to log in and works wonderfully. Just don't forget that you will have to do this daily. Your wireless will work, just wait for the login screen which might take a second to open up. Upon checking out we saw all the extra internet charges on our bill, they crossed out the extras and told us they will either not show up on our credit card bill or be a separate credit...........and that is exactly what happened when we saw our statement. Great hotel, great location, and superior customer service is what we found at Hotel Napoleon. Thank you to the staff for providing such a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Classic Parisian Decor”
Reviews.Author: NoahKAllen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a block of the Champs-Elysees, which makes it ideal for tourists trying to to see the sites. You can walk or take the 1 down to the Louvre, Tuileries, Bastille etc. and you're not too far from Eiffel Tower. I stayed in a suite on the top floor with a spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower - literally looked like something out of a movie. I was able to have a glass of winer on the balcony and slept well above the noise. I lived in Paris for a few years and used to work on the Champs Elysees, so I prefer to stay more towards the center: there aren't a ton of great restaurants/night spots on the Champs (save for a few big clubs and so-so restaurants) and everything tends to be more expensive. it's a bit like going to NYC and staying on Times Square. So if you're younger or looking to be really active during the night, I wouldn't recommend this location. That being said, it's less hectic than other parts of the city late at night and probably good for people with families and overall, I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Paris con..Run down ,seedy, dank smelling ,dark, overpriced hotel with poor service living on past glory”
Reviews.Author: BanajiMumbai
Reviews.Content: the bell "boy" was an old drunk man in crumpled clothes. The lobby was dark dingy and smelly. Obviously the hotel had seen better days but it was a tattered , tired, pathetic reminder of its past. Our Junior suite with "balcony" has a "balcony" that was best described as a ledge with some flowers ..A desk blocked the doors to the balcony and even if it did not.. there was no place to stand on the balcony at all. The room decor was dirty and tatty, surfaces had dust , upholstry was torn and dirty and the airconditioner did not work and could not be repaired. We booked for 6 days and left in disgust in 2 ... and the desk tried to con us into paying for six mind you!! A sad depressing place that bears no resemblance to the pictures on their website.. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL if you are an American, or visitor who is used to the clean top notch hotels of the east.

Reviews.Title: “All show and NO substance”
Reviews.Author: KevinB27
Reviews.Content: Just got back, and very disappointed with the Hotel, pictures showed superb rooms, what I actually got was a very small room, at a high cost. Took my luggage up but was left at the door to fend for myself, when entering the room looked for the wardrobe, found a very small one, it had shelves at the top, unfortunately used to store cushions, and the bottom was occupied with a mini bar, leaving 8 " to hang our clothes for 2 persons, meaning we had to hang them from doors on the outside, I went to complain but was told, yes it is small but no other rooms were available, which I doubted, and showed no concern for our comfort, the only reason the bar was there was to charge exorbitant prices for snacks, to get even more money for example, half box of Pringles for $5 euros, at the cost of the comfort of the guests. Advertised as king size beds, actually two singles pushed together, if I had not prepaid, would have left there and then.

Reviews.Title: “Upmarket hotel at reasonable rates but room was very small.”
Reviews.Author: fsquare
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the Arc De Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. Service was very good, particularly helpful with the Shuttle service that was (for them) predictably 30 minutes late. Without their advice we would have been in a panic. The entry level room was very small however and you had to create your own traffic light system to move around.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Over-rated...No stars unless one plucks from the sky!”
Reviews.Author: Heppy08
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights recently. Rooms are very small. Air-conditioned was not working throughout the stay and we had to open the window every night. Was told hotel full and cant changed room. The housekeeping promised a fan for the night but never heard from them at all after that. Likewise was promised a room change the next day but that did not materialised. Extremely shabby service overall.They should really come to Asia to learn what excellent hotel services one can find. The only plus point is the location and full stop.

Reviews.Title: “another perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this hotel and we love it due to its fabulous location & spacious suites. Check-in: All went accordingly to plan and we were shown to our room. On opening the door we were disappointed it wasn’t the same size suite as our last stay. We rang reception immediately & asked whether we had the correct room. Staff informed us that our last stay we had booked a suite whilst this stay we had booked a junior suite which explained the different sizes. Staff were lovely and allowed us to check out 3 other Junior Suites to see which one we preferred, we ended up choosing Room 412. Room – Our room was very comfortable with a king size bed, sitting area with a superior size working desk, mini bar, large TV, and air-conditioning. We also had a separate walk-in wardrobe with a safe. Bathroom – Had been recently renovated and was “spanking new’ with a lovely fresh feel. The bathroom also had a separate large bath & walk-in shower & big vanity unit. Towels were fluffy & soft too. Staff – We have always found the staff to be very friendly & helpful. The laundry service is also first-class. Breakfast – Is expensive, so try & get it included into your price. Its ordinary & one can just walk down the street & pickup a cheaper breakfast for half the price. Location – Is absolutely fabulous just a 2min walk to Avenue des Champs Elysees, the Metro & around the corner from the Arc de Triomphe. At the moment – the hotel is putting in a new lift which will be great for better service as the only one lift can at times be very slow. The noise was a little annoying but it didn’t really affect us at all. Overall – Loved our week stay and we will return again shortly `.

Reviews.Title: “Abolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: superstarCA
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from two nights at the Napoleon Hotel with my adult daughter. The hotel is a beautiful traditional hotel with lots of atmoshphere. This is not a big modern faceless place. The staff couldn't do enough for us and ALL of them were utterly charming. The location is wonderful, just off the Champs Elysee and you can almost touch the Arc de Triomphe from your window. Would always stay here again

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location!”
Reviews.Author: MaxGS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Napoleon for two nights during June 2010 after making a last minute reservation at a bargain price. The hotel is conveniently located very close to the Arc de Triumphe and the underground entrance to the Charles de Gaulle-Etoile metro and RER station (which takes you direclty to Eurodisney) is just outside the hotel's dootstep. Staff was courteous and helpful. Our room was not very large, but it was clean and, although the building seems to be quite old, the bathroom was renovated and had all modern facilities. We did not try the breakfast as it was not included in the price (and was in the region of EUR 20 per person per day) and we preferred to stroll to the nearby Champs Elysees which has many cafes. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Napoleon and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jskippy
Reviews.Content: I ask ed for a cab from the front desk clerk. the desk clerk called a cab that was a friend or someone that knew him. the front desk clerk and the cab driver quoted me a price to the airport and changed the rate. i asked him about the changed rate and he said i will take you back. i said take me back to the hotel and the driver then said I do not speak english. i ask for instructions for a restaurant and was told how many times do you want to have me repeat the instructions. i only asked once for the instructions to be repeated. the tv wasn't working correctly and we called room service. a gentlemen arrived and fixed the problem but acted like we were bothering him. i went to check out of the hotel at 5 am and found the desk clerk snoring on the couch. the clerk had to be awakened by the other employee to check me out. The staff was not friendly and two of three night clerks had body odor and looked like they slept their uniforms. The hotel and rooms look much better on the internet. the hotel has four stars at best this hotel is a two star hotel. the rooms are clean but very dated in decor like from the sixties. the fake flowers in the room were full of dust and the room smells musty. we were booked in a jr. suite. The front door to our hotel room did not have a double lock it was broken so it was removed.i stayed at the softiel hotel around the corner for business it was great location, excellent customer service, and great food. i wish i would have stayed at the softiel. if i did not book a non refundable rate i would have checked out. This hotel was referred to me by a friend of a friend who's main reason for picking this hotel was price. I learned this after my trip. My tip pick another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A truly memorable experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bbch2009
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a perfect experience in Paris and we found it. We loved Hotel Napoleon. Our family of four, our children are 10 and 6, enjoyed the location and the ambiance of Hotel Napoleon. The staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable. The location is incredible - steps away from the Arch de Triomphe and also steps away from the Metro. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, walk in closet sized room”
Reviews.Author: HoneymoonersThailand
Reviews.Content: Old hotel, uncomfortable & tiny room. Very expensive & not great breakfast. You're paying for the location - but there are better hotels to be had in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Almost ideal for short trips to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: porgyrato
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling at least once a month to Paris and used to stay in ***** hotels in the Champs-Elysées area. Mostly for business. I tried the Napoléon Hotel for the first time as I have been travelling along with 8 people which is unusual for me but I must say that I had a very good experience. The people in my company also shared the same satisfaction. Especially when comparing the benefits versus the cost, I presume this was a very high ranking. I shall consider staying more in this hotel on my next trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “appauling”
Reviews.Author: melz86London
Reviews.Content: I was meant to be enjoying a romantic weekend with my partner for valentines. We went to disneyland for the day and i left a DO NOT DISTURB sign on my door. When i returned to my room the sign had been removed and i walked in to find my underwear displayed on the bed (which was in my suitcase when i left), my partners boxers on the other side with heart chocolates in the middle. My suitcase had been turned upside down, and a pack of condoms which were also in the suitcase were clearly displayed on the bedside table. When i went to the reception desk to complain about this appauling behaviour, all i got was 'the cleaner has gone home'. If you are thinking of staying here, DON'T, the staff are rude and you cant trust them. Absolutely appauling i would never ever stay here again, it ruined my weekend.

Reviews.Title: “I'm afraid I go to Paris ....”
Reviews.Author: mat2009
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation at a good price, for me and my wife, for 4 ore 5 nights at the Hotel Napoleon, in Paris. It was the most awful nightmare that I lived in a foreign country. Nowhere I felt more offended and more threatened. After three days of accommodation to return to the hotel after a day of work I was subjected to interrogation by the hotel manager. The story was briefly next. The woman who was cleaning the rooms had been punctured in the leg with a syringe needle in the trash in our room. He arrived at the hospital and they gave the police statements. I was treat like a criminal and forced to say what was in the syringe while my wife could not enter in the room because they did not gave us the key. Needless to say there was no one syringe. As there was no cleaning-woman who have injured. There is no admission or a complaint to the Police. It was only a big french lie, a setup done in a horrible way for us to clear the room and who a day earlier and to hold the money they paid by us in advance. Matre d’hotel with an ugly character than of a russian man-prostitutes.... Later I learned that if you have not be checking out, anyway they should have paid. The rooms, beautiful in fact, there are many objects of some value. For any damage to their pay .. Especially if you don’t want to from minibar! For me there was hardly a case of money. Offending that we had surpassed any imagination. Frankly I'm afraid I go to Paris ....

Reviews.Title: “expensive for a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: talloaks042
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently for 3 nights , the first room we were offered was very small , tired and dated so we agreed to pay an extra 50 euros per night for an upgrade to a suite . We didn't try the breakfast as this again would have been an extra 50 euros per day . Only 2 english t.v. channels ( very poor) . Hotel is in a good location for Arc de triomphe , champs eleysee etc and staff were friendly but we did feel like everything in Paris it was overpriced. 9 euros for a pint and 12 euros for a spirit and mixer is not funny ! I would recommend this hotel only if you get a really good deal on the price and insist on a suite, the others rooms are just not worth it .

Reviews.Title: “magnifigue!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrepapi
Reviews.Content: we did a 10 days honeymoon in paris..awesome!!!great city,best hotel ever in the perfect spot!!service,breakfast,people absolutely great!!

Reviews.Title: “In the best location possible”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: If you are a tourist this is a good option. It is 1 block away from Champs Elysees, near Arch of Triumph. The rooms are little small but you can ask for an upgrade if available You can also take the metro station in Friedland Avenue, so you can conect wherever you want to go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comme un été à Paris...”
Reviews.Author: aimeelizpr
Reviews.Content: Lovely time we had in Paris on Summer 2009. My husband proposed to me in Paris and we stayed at this wonderful hotel just few steps from the Arch of Triumph. Very classy European, clean, excellent service and the beautiful canopy beds are like clouds in heaven! It's a 4 star rated hotel but to me was 5 stars! ohh La La!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location, nice.”
Reviews.Author: Johnboyholidaykid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights on business in October and it was a return visit. On my first visit the room was better (bigger) and I guess its luck of the draw. A bit old fashioned overall but nice. Very well situated and only two mins walk from the Arc and Charles de Galle metro. Clean room, but TV did not work on BBC as advertised. That said was not worried about this due to small amount of spare time I had, but inconvenient first thing in the morning. Breakfast was fair, and part of the room rate which was better than the large chain hotels rate. Would stay here again on business, but not sure about on a leisure trip, as prefer a bit more luxury then.

Reviews.Title: “This is a jewel”
Reviews.Author: lacrossemom1
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16 year old daughter and I just returned from France, ending with a 3 night stay at the Napoleon. This is my third visit to this hotel over the course of 40 years. I first stayed here with my parents as a 12 year old, my boyfriend and I got engaged during our stay at the Napoleon in 1985, and we now visited with our daughter. We got a terrific deal due to the time of year, and by paying in full at the time of booking. This was a SIGNIFICANT savings. We had a corner Junior Suite on Avenue de Friedland. Our room was outstanding, with a view of a portion of the Arc de Triomphe (beautifully lit at night), and the Eiffel Tower with its fabulous light show. The staff could not have been nicer. When we mentioned to the bellman that we had gotten engaged while staying at the hotel in 1985, he passed the word to the desk staff, who immediately sent up a bottle of champagne. Very classy and much appreciated. Carlos the daytime concierage, was extremely helpful with all sorts of requests. The public rooms are beautifully furnished. Housekeeping was excellent, and the breakfast, although pricey, was delicious. The location of the hotel, one street over from the Champs-Elysees is wonderful. This hotel is a little jewel. Can't say enough good things about it and our recent stay.

Reviews.Title: “DONTstay here - no idea how its rated so highly”
Reviews.Author: Martinius34
Reviews.Content: The only good thing is the location.... hotel has ZERO amenities, service is dreadful, Internet completely intermittent... and I HAD A COLD SHOWER... in a four star hotel... the boilers were down this morning... I am paying 280Euros/night... on a super duper deal.. blah blah... and have a little pokey room facing a wall in the back... not good in ANY WAY>>>>

Reviews.Title: “Unethical”
Reviews.Author: globalhotels
Reviews.Content: Hotel made agreement with my host and when hosts' card was declined they charged all rooms to my credit card on the auspice that it was illegal for me to leave with payment. fighting it tooth and nail- love paris but this place almost ruined the love affair with the city ...Not worth it

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Silvia017
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon for 7 nights. When we arrived, we were offered an upgrade to a suite with a balcony. Of course, this was not for free (nothing is for free in Paris!!!) but we negotiated free breakfast and internet which almost covered the cost of the upgrade. I could see the Eiffel lying on my bed so what else can I say? It is an expensive hotel, yet old so it needs some updating, but the bathroom was absolutely new. The breakfast is outrageously expensive (€32/person) but it's not worth the price. I would suggest having breakfast somewhere else. The location was perfect, one block from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elyssees. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great location and are willing to pay more than $250/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Thomas C
Reviews.Content: I selected the Napolean based upon other reviews and was very satisfied with my decision. I was there for the conclusion of the Tour de France, which is a crowded and hectic time in this area of the city. The Napolean provided a sanctuary from the crowds. The hotel is located just 1/2 block to the Champs and the Arc. My room was very good (it appears I must have had an updated room based upon other reviewers). An underground public parking lot is located across the street which was very convenient. All in all a very good experience. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: livininathens
Reviews.Content: I recently won a trip to Paris for three days and the Hotel Napoleon was part of that package. After reading the mixed reviews of the hotel I was curious to see what my experience would bring. Upon check-in, I was pleasantly surprised, everyone was very accommodating, friendly and professional. As I was traveling with a friend rather than spouse, the reception desk said they did not know this, as a double room was booked and informed us they would separate the beds for us. Which they did before we returned to the room. Upon entering the room, it was nice, and by European standards (most are small) it was adequate. How much time do you really spend in your room in Paris? When we requested extra pillows and ice, both we brought to us promptly. The decor was nice at first look, but a little worn in areas, nothing that turned us off to the hotel. The room was a little warm, even though we had rain and cool weather outdoors, but the windows opened to the courtyard and it was very pleasant. As for the bathroom, it was a good size and very nicely done. The one problem we had was the shower, since there was only a small glass partition, rather than an enclosure, flooded the bath the first morning. After that, we simply had to be more cautious when showering. Again, not a big problem. We had the breakfast buffet included with our room and were very satisfied. There was ample selections of hot foods, Bacon, Scrambled Eggs, Potatoes, Hard cooked Eggs, crepes and more. They also had a very nice selection of fruits, vegetables and yogurts and juices. The coffee was excellent. The location was perfect, it is one block from the Charles De Gaulle/ Etoile metro station and the Arc de Triomphe. Within a few blocks walking you are in the middle of Champs -Elysses and all the shopping and restaurants. Overall I would stay here again and would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Undergoing renovations”
Reviews.Author: vandyalum82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a "junior suite avenue" on the hotels website. I had requested a view of the Eiffel Tower from our terrace. Check in was efficient and polite. Two porters accompanied us to our car in the underground garage next door and took our luggage to the room. As we got off the elevator on to our floor the carpet was taped over because they were doing renovations down the hall. We did have a view of the Eiffel Tower from our terrace. The terraces are not private or separated from the adjacent rooms in any way. The room was spacious enough but there was a bad smell in the bathroom. It went away but the bathroom wasn't exactly cleaned the next day. The towels were a bit old and didn't smell very pleasant. The first night we received no turn down service, which wouldn't ordinarily be a problem, but we had to search for our pillows as they were not on the bed. The lobby and lounge areas are very nice and everyone we encountered was polite. The location is excellent. However, I don't think I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: jdmh3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Napoleon many times over the years and never been disappointed. We recognize up front that the room sizes may be smaller than U.S. standards, so usually we upgrade to the suite. This time we just took the regular room and were very pleased. The bed was comfortable not like stone in some hotels of Europe. Towels were plentiful and constant. Staff has always spoken fluent English and never let us down with directions or help, including umbrellas for the rain. Can't wait til next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: CoopsSussex
Reviews.Content: We went for a mid week break and had a wonderful experience, I think we where lucky and had a recently re-furbished room, the room was small but perfectly decorated and clean. The Hotel staff where very helpful, I gave the Porter a small tip once he struggled with our bags and he was very happy and decide to show me the features of the room, safe, Mini Bar etc. When we came back to our room each evening the bed had been turned down and a chocolate on our pillow, this may have been as I mentioned it was our anniversary but a nice touch. Location was perfect, Just by “Arc de Triomphe” and the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: KathyC5454
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have been planning a trip to France for several years and stayed in the Hotel Napoleon for four nights. We were both disappointed with the hotel for several reasons. The room we were given was extremely small and in deplorable condition. We should have requested another room immediately -- but did not. Our room overlooked the "courtyard" -- the floor of which was covered in green moss. Our view consisted of a large fabric construction barrier and a large building crane just on the other side of the barrier. The outside wall of the room had obviously been water damaged which resulted in peelng wallpaper, plaster, and water stains. (I have provided pictures of this.) The air conditioning didn't work and the room was quite stuffy. The beds were uncomfortable. The linens were of poor quality -- both bed and bath. The furniture was borken, chipped, and dirty. The hotel employs a "master switch" for electricity in the room -- you must leave your room key in the slot for the electricity to work. This was not explained to us -- so we left the spare card in the slot the first time we left the room and it was confiscated. Another downside to this system is that you cannot control the lights in the room independently -- it's either all on or all off. The hotel does not provide free internet service to its guests -- and the cost is ridiculous. And a three minute phone call to the U.S. from our room phone cost almost $15.00. On the plus side -- and in keeping with other reviews -- the hotel is conveniently located within a half block of the Charles de Galle Metro station. I suppose that some rooms must have had a view of the magnificent Arc de Triomphe. The showers were wonderful in the marble bathrooms. And to top it off -- the staff is very unfriendly and not accommodating and this is completely unforgivable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Touring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mystie
Reviews.Content: Transportation- the hotel is 2-3 minutes walk away to the RER/Metro (trains) stations. The Air France bus from Charles De Gaulle airport (Line 2), stops about 4 streets away, about 5 minutes walk away. It's located very close to the top of the Aveunue de Friedland, which means that you only have to cross the main street to get to Champs Elysee, one of the most famous streets in Paris. At the top of the Champs Elysee, you'll be able to catch the LesCarsRouge (open top bus) to get to some of the most popular tourist sites- this is the scenic way to travel Paris, rather than be stuck on the underground trains. Rooms- small, but spacious enough, especially for a major city like Paris. Have stayed in smaller when we were in London. We booked the cheapest class of rooms- but found it perfectly adequate. There was a bathtub/shower, and was well-equipt with toiletries. There's even a neat little tucked-away wardrobe by the door. If you're fussy about the having a bigger room- can always ask for an upgrade (at additional cost) when you arrive, they'll give you a discounted rate if the bigger suites aren't booked up. Booked the room on the hotel website, where they were offering 3 nights for the price of 2. Excellent stuff. Whilst expensive, the location itself was well worth it! Loads of nice cafes and restaurants all along the Champs Elysee, great view of the Arc de Triomphe from the hotel, and we could also see the top bit of the Eiffel Tower. For designer lovers, do not miss out on visiting the Avenue Montaigne, (at the end of Champs Elysee, on the right), where all the designer boutiques reside. Wonderful place. Boutiques include Dior, Gucci, LV, Versace, etc... Front desk was efficient and friendly. The bellboy was a bit snobbish!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Skimeup
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here as part of a timeshare club and we upgraded to a larger room with breakfast for two for an addition 100 E per night. The staff was very welcoming and friendly for the whole week - they went out of their way to be helpful and informative and they truly seemed to care that we were enjoying ourselves. The room furnishings are elegant, the beds excellent, and the balcony looks onto the street and with some headbending the Arc de Triomphe. The breakfast is pricey (26 E per person) but truly a feast. Real eggs in the scrambled eggs (or they will fix yours any style you like) , great cappuchino, and more pastries, meats, and extraordinary fruit dishes than you could sample in a week. I walked by some of the other places we considered and they were not even close in terms of location and attractiveness. The smallest of their rooms is quite small - I think you can by pass getting one of those by requesting twin beds.... They can be pushed together and the rooms containing those are larger.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, but---”
Reviews.Author: aalee
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my husband and my get away based on the location, reviews and pictures. I arrived after an overnight flight exhausted and had requested an early check in. (My husband was meeting me the next day.) They immediately took me to my room which was booked as a superior king. I was in disbelief! The porter did not need to speak English to understand my disappointment! He called the desk, said a few words in French and whisked me off to another room. This was about the same---old, worn, paint chipped, shabby in every way. I just nodded "no" and the porter guided me back to the desk. Having booked through a 3rd party, everything was paid for so I knew I had to stay. I quietly told the manager that this was not what I paid for and that I could sleep on the floor I was so tired but I could NOT sleep in those rooms. He told me that if I could wait until 4 PM he would see what he could do. They stored my bags until I returned and brought me to a beautiful newly refurbished (but tiny) room. You could still smell the fresh paint! The bathroom was gorgeous but the rain shower was not yet hooked up. However, we did have a luxurious bathtub. Everything was immaculate, the service was great and the concierge, in particular was very helpful. I'm glad I didn't settle for less. I would highly recommend this hotel but only if you are given one of the refurbished rooms. Trust me, the older ones would not be worth the price we paid! The location is perfect, especially with the Metro right outside the door. BTW, the wireless internet was not working and the air conditioning could not be turned on unless most guests requested it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: ktrockz
Reviews.Content: Brilliantly located next to the Arc de Triomphe. Beautiful building, friendly useful service. Easily accessible by RER and Metro. Worthwhile stay, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris! Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jacq2319
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Paris for the first time last year for my birthday. We stayed at the Hotel Napoleon, and I couldn't have asked for a better experience. The hotel felt truly Parisian and really added to my first trip to France. The staff was wonderful and helpful from the very first moment we walked in the door until we left. They even upgraded our room for free when they found out it was my birthday. They helped us learn how to get around town and just seemed to really care about our overall experience. The room was magnificient. It was clean and well-decorated. I felt like I was staying in a Parisian apartment rather than a hotel. The location couldn't be beat. We were right next to the Metro and within walking distance to eateries and sightseeing, including the Arc de Triumph. Overall, this ranks as one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. I can't imagine staying anywhere else the next time I travel to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SBfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and our 10 and 13 year old sons, stayed for four nights at Hotel Napoleon. The hotel is easy to find, and right next to the Metro and RER station. We had reserved a Jr. Suite Avenue, thinking it could fit all four of us (my mistake). The front desk said it could not and moved us to a Sr. Suite for only 30 euro more per night. Our room overlooked the Ave. de Friedland. We didn't have a view of the Arc de Triomphe nor the Eiffel Tower, but it was still a nice view. The boys slept on a pull-out couch, which was very comfortable and roomy. There was a pocket door that separated our bedroom from the living room that the boys were sleeping in, which was nice. Our bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was lovely. My only complaint is the room got hot during the night (even though is was in the low 40's outside!), so we would have to open the window, which meant street noise. The staff was very nice and accommodating. They always greeted us when we walked by the front desk. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The staff goes out of their way to please their clients”
Reviews.Author: MariaFrench
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Napoleon makes business travel seem almost like a vacation. The hotel is beautiful decorated and through the many historic pieces of art, the client senses the greatness of the Emperor Napoleon. The staff accommodates all my needs and helps me coordinate a day of constant business meetings. There is always a smiling face at the reception and the staff is very knowledge about Paris. I wouldn't think of staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: collettecokerry
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were fantastic. The room we were offered was nice thought at the rear of the hotel and no view at all. We looked onto the building behind. We had a drink in the hotel bar, one brandy and one glass of wine, the price was too expensive dont have adrink here if you can avoid it. The location was the best in all we had a plesant stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel choice, ready to return”
Reviews.Author: Hope1215
Reviews.Content: Hotel ideally located, very helpful staff, gorgeous rooms. I can't say enough good about the hotel. We are already wishing we could return...

Reviews.Title: “If the words location location location mean anything to you this is YOUR Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasDadWaco
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first visit to PARIS and the Napoleon Hotel. It will not be our last! The Napoleon is located right where you want to be! We were able to walk to anywhere we wanted. Rooms in Paris were reported to be small and outdated. NOT the case here. Our Jr Suite was spacious and the bathroom was quite large. The Walk In closet was a nice touch. I can'nt say enough about the staff, if we asked they did it, if we thought about something they did it! Exceptional! Anyone who has ANY apprciation for ART needs to visit Paris if they can. Be prepared to WALK and climb stairs! Don't worry about the stories of rude French people, we saw NONE. Go & Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms & helpful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: JodieNI
Reviews.Content: Hi, Went to Paris for a romantic wknd break and wasn't disappointed. T This hotel really was beautiful and based in a great location for site seeing. Would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, excellent service, individual approach.”
Reviews.Author: petradm
Reviews.Content: Fine, excellent service, individual approach. Has pleasantly surprised a variety of kitchen and responsiveness of attendants. In a word, all at high level. We are going to stop repeatedly in May in this hotel and we will recommend to its our friends. Yours faithfully, Peter, Elena.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!!”
Reviews.Author: lafashionstylist
Reviews.Content: Will definitely stay here again, friendly staff, nice lobby and decoration...hotel room could have been a bit bigger but it is a good value for a reasonable price. The location is amazingly central, take a 2 minute walk to the arc de trium, champs elysee, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff, cleanliness and service”
Reviews.Author: RBH72
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Napoleon on numerous occasions, visiting Paris several times per year on business. Its ratings are justified, you are treated as a person, not a number from the moment you make your booking. This type of respect is extended to all interactions with staff, from the chambermaid to bellboys. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and larger than average, and have all the amenities that one would expect with added touched like original artwork, photographs and rooms which have been lived in by some famous people, e.g. Ella Fitzgerald. Whenever I have needed anything extra, it has been with me within minutes of being requested. The Naopleon is somewhere you will enjoy being at and enjoy looking forward to going.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to going back”
Reviews.Author: KenandKaren
Reviews.Content: Location would have to be the best in Paris, with everything at your fingertips. A comfortable walk to all of the most interesting sites and locations around Paris. Decor and service were excellent. The room was wonderfully over-upholstered which gave a comfortable feel that made the evenings very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned charm and good service”
Reviews.Author: RecruiterTheHague
Reviews.Content: I first stayed in the Napoleon in 2007 and still keep coming back. Perfect location, value for money and extremely helpful and friendly personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel In An Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: goldkold
Reviews.Content: This hotel enjoys what has to be one of the nicest locations in Paris, literally a one minute walf from the Arc De Triomphe and the famous Champs Elyesses, and I would have loved to give it 5 stars if it wasn't for a few minor issues. But let me begin with the good points. Besides the location, the housekeeping in this hotel is fantastic with twice daily maid service, abundant amenities and towels, delicious chocolates at turndown, a welcoming box of chocolates and Evian water when i checked in, a very Parisian atmosphere with paintings and old style furniture, a fireplace, a fancy if not big lobby, and a friendly staff. Also loved the hand held bidet andd the tropical shower, such a rarity for Paris. However, the hotel has some minor issues, first of all the water leaked from the shower stall everytime I used the shower, The price is quite high, the TV remote was not working properly during my stay and had to be fixed more than once. But overall, this hotel is great and would love to stay at it again.

Reviews.Title: “Short but fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: EmanueleVicentini
Reviews.Content: From when I arrived till I checked out, I could not have had a more special treatment. The staff is superb and very kind and the location is unique. They upgraded my room so I enjoyed the view of the Arc de Triumph out of the window of my suite. Hotel was very close to both Metro stations and RER, so getting all around is very simple. The siute room was big and very very well furnished, with a spectacular huge mirror in the entrance. Both breakfast and lunch at their finest. Business rooms are silent and absolutely comfortable. I would recommend to all and will surely stay there again on my next trip to Paris. A bientot

Reviews.Title: “Pefect location for first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: twinklec28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Napoleon from 12/06/08 – 12/13/08. The hotel has great charm and was very cozy. My husband booked the hotel directly through their website and took advantage of the special internet pricing. They knew it was our one year wedding anniversary and when we entered our room we were happily surprised with a box of complimentary shortbread cookies and a bottle of water with a note congratulating us on our anniversary. The hotel is in the process of updating some of the rooms, so if you are lucky you may end up with one of these newer rooms. The location was very convient; we were 1 block from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs-Elysees. We were in room 602, which had a lovely view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was small but as expected in Paris while the bathroom was a decent size. Our room was cleaned daily, and there is also turn down service every night. There is internet connection, but you have to pay for either 8 Euro for 1 hour for the day or 21 Euro for 24 hours. The heating was strong, and at times we had to open our balcony door to cool down the room. The hotel offers breakfast, but at a very high price, so we decided to get breakfast at the many cafés along the Champs-Elysees. The hotel staff was very nice and friendly and helped us get situated to Paris. The concierge provided us with a power converter as the one we brought along failed to work. He was also very helpful in providing recommendations for restaurants and ways to get around the city. The shops and restaurants on the Champs are a bit pricey, but it you venture into the side streets off the Champs there are some very good finds in terms of cafes and bistros all at reasonable prices. One last note on the hotel location is that it is one block from the Charles de Gaulle Etoile metro station. The trains serviced at this station are the 1, 2, and 6 lines as well as the RER train. The 1 line goes to either La Defense (business district) or to many stops along the Champs-Elysees and also to the Louvre. You can take the 2 line to Montmartre where you can hike up to Sacre Coeur or stop by the Moulin Rouge (be careful of the street peddlers at the base of Sacre Coeur as they are very pushy and grabby). Lastly the 6 train will drop you off at Trocadero which provides a wonderful approach to the Eiffel Tower (visit here at night to view the tower light up every hour).

Reviews.Title: “a little dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: lindsey381
Reviews.Content: We were a bit dissapointed in this hotel. The website is a little misleading with the pictures of the grand rooms with luxurious looking amenities. The hotel lobby area and bar are okay, but then getting to your room is a little bit of a different story. The rooms look like a much watered-down version of what was on the website. Small and cramped with very old (I can appreciate antiques, but this furniture wasn't) furniture and bedding. Our bathroom had been remodeled, but the shower still didn't work properly and it took about 1 hour to fill the bathtub. The breakfast was good but not worth the money and the staff were okay, not overly freindly by any means. The bright spot with this hotel was the location, right near the corner of the Champs Elysees and the Arch De Triumph. Overall we were diappointed in our stay here, will defnitely go elsewhere next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: Esson_GR
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris at the end of November, to spend 4 days in the city of light. Having read several reports, I knew roughly what to expect from hotels in that city although it has been our first visit to France. Luckily we have picked the Napoleon for our stay, due to encouraging reports on this site and an interesting offer on the hotel's website. We were very happy with the hotel and here are a few reasons why : 1.Location: Without a doubt the hotel's biggest asset is its location, being a few minutes walk from the Charles de Gaulle-Etoile metro station, the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe, the hotel is in a safe and elegant part of the city, close to shops and (through the metro) close to all major Paris attractions. If you feel like walking instead you will find that there are wonderful walks down to the Eiffel Tower (should be less than 20mins), through the 16th arrondissement, one of the posh areas in Paris. As a matter of fact, other sites are also within walking distance down the spectacular Champs Elysees (weather and physical condition permitting). Please note that Avenue Friedland can get busy on weekdays and some traffic noise is heard even when windows are closed. For me this was not an issue and I like the idea of being close to the heart of the city. Do not take me wrong, the noise is not loud enough to keep you awake in the night or wake you up early on a busy morning, but it was somehow noticeable when the room was very quiet. This may be a problem for some but it shouldn't be for most people. 2.Room: Well OK, our standard room (4th floor facing Av.Friedland) seemed a little small, although bigger than what I initially expected when reading that this is normally the case in Paris. In any case it was very stylish with books, paintings and very romantic lighting, and it gave us the feeling we're at home rather than in a hotel a few thousand miles from it. The room was practical with decent room for our personal items, a very nice flat sat-TV and (what was more important during our stay) a very effective heating system. It provided all we needed in a very unique package, unlike many hotels that look more or less the same. 3.Bathroom:You cannot expect a big bathroom in a relatively small room right? Nevertheless, although the hotel aims to create a 18th-19th century atmosphere, the bathroom was very modern and adequate in size (which for me is good, since that its a place where advances in technology are more than welcome).
