We did have a minor problem with the drain when we first arrived but notified the staff and it has been fixed in no time. 4.Service: The feeling that I was at home rather than in a hotel was enhanced by the level of service. You could never see them, or hear them, but the room was always in a perfect condition. Our privacy had always been respected and for me this is one of my main concerns when traveling. Check in/out took less than 5 minutes and although my French is, well ..understandable to say the least, even when I was using English I had no problem with the reception staff. 5.Breakfast: The warm and stylish atmosphere of the Napoleon can also be found in the Cafe Bivouac, which is essentially the place where breakfast is served, but also a nice cafe/bar or restaurant in the evenings. Breakfast is a little pricey yes, and some could argue that there is not a huge variety. I say that for its size the hotel offers a great choice of high quality food served at a very elegant place. I am not a great fan of huge buffets, still I cannot think of anything the average person would desire which was not offered in the Napoleon. Overall, I have no experience from other hotels in Paris, but I have had experience from several hotels around the world. The Napoleon is small, friendly and very stylish. It is ideally located, offers multilingual service, it is clean, quiet and the food (at least the breakfast I tried) is excellent. I cannot think of any reason why I should want to try a different hotel in that city and yes, if I return to Paris, I will try to book in the Napoleon again. I have recommended it to my friends and definitely I do recommend it to any potential visitor of that amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Even Napoleon would have liked it...”
Reviews.Author: The-Mystic-Bunnies
Reviews.Content: Flew from LA - Paris on Air France. Air France lost 1/3 of our luggage. Wasn't too pleased with the entire Air France experience. That being said, a 50 euro taxi ride (40 minutes) to Napoloen from the airport. The front desk and concierge staff were all very pleasant and helpful. All spoke fluent English; however, we always try to speak the local language, which I think in France, in particular, helps. We met very kind and helpful French people everywhere and only had two what I would call over-the-top-unwarranted 'unfriendly' experiences, one with the ticket lady at the Arc De Triomphe and one with the visitor center guards at the Normandy cemetary (which really, really PMO)...we were the only ones at the cemetary and they treated us like terrorists...way over the top bag searches, rudeness, remove your jackets, etc., etc..these guards are French and paid by the US cemetary services or something. I know security is a concern, but they were extremely rude, one of them in particular. And believe me, it was unprovoked. Oh well, enough of that. The hotel was very charming and clean. We had a Junior suite which was very big for European standards...huge king bed, fold out sofa, desk, coffee table, entry-way and large, two-sink bathroom. There were places where the paint was peeling off around the room; they could make a pass through with a fresh coat of paint and maybe a carpet refresh. So, although nice, don't expect a Four seasons or Ritz experience. But again, don't let this sway your opinion - very nice place. We had a great view of Avenue de Friedland and about 1/2 of the Arc de Triomphe. The kid stayed in her own 'standard' room which was also very nice, with a 'garden view' - not really a garden, though - but more of a courtyard/patio. Breakfast was very nice, and convenient....I would opt for this since there is not much open early in the morning on the Champs de Lysee except a french version of a fast food pastry place, and yes, a McDonalds. As far as the hotel location - only a stone's throw from the Arc. Very quiet in the room with windows closed, which we had closed since it was freezing outside. Heat worked great. Room service very good. Very easy acces to subway/metro. Don't be intimidated by the metro - very easy to get around, and much less expensive than a taxi. For instance, it will cost 1.8 euro to get to Monmarte by metro and about 20 for a taxi (with no traffic). You could walk to the Louvre from the hotel, down the Champ de Lysee, but it will take probably an hour. By metro, only a 10 minute ride. We did a minibus tour through Viator for Normandy, Point du Hoc and Juno beach ( I recommend) as well as a Seine dinner cruise, Louvre tour and bicycle tour of Versailles. We've had really good luck with Viator all over Europe. They can arrange cattle-call tourist tours or private tours, too. On the metro, we visited Monmarte, Notre Dame, Eiffel tower and a few other places. There were no lines to speak of anywhere, since it was so cold and 'the low season'. We prefer this though, since I can't imagine the-packed-like-sardines elevator ride up the eiffel in 100-degree summer heat. Several restaurants up and down the Champs by the hotel, but I'd recommend venturing up and down the side streets to pick your place to eat. As always, I'm sure many of you know - wait until the airport to use your ATM/debit for cash. Don't use those cash-exchange services ('rip-off') If you are asked if you want your credit card charged dollars or euros, pick euros...as this will be much less expensive when your CC company does the conversion. There is no 'Arc De Triomphe' exit on the metro - you get off at the Charles De Gaulle exit for the Napoleon. Buy a metro pass, try the metro and don't be afraid - very easy. Anyway, Napoleon was very nice with a very nice staff....and very fairly priced. You won't be disappointed... Our neighbor recommended the Hotel Regina, which was right next to the Louvre, that looked nice too. Paris is a very, very beautiful city - dare we say the most beautiful we've seen in the world - and you'd need a month to see only part of it. And, finally, God Bless all the US, Canadian and Brit soldiers that are buried around Normandy - 9000 US at the main cemetary, but there is also a Canadian cemetary with 2300 dead not to far from Normandy that we never know about. Hard to keep back the tears when you stand in the middle of all that.

Reviews.Title: “The Napoleon is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanFraser
Reviews.Content: Great hotel brilliantly located! Situated just next to the Arc De Troimphe and Champs Elysee this hotel is a great base for any tourist to Paris. Staff are friendly, breakfasts are sumptuous and rooms are comfortable...just a little small...but then again, it's Paris and no hotel rooms are big! We enjoyed our 3 night stay and staff were always ready to lend a hand wherever possible. It's right next to the metro and is really in a great location! Restaurants in the area are pricy but offer a great variety! We enjoyed our stay tremendously and wouldn't hesitate to go back!

Reviews.Title: “COMPLETE RELAXATION, GREAT LOCATION !”
Reviews.Author: mariagreece
Reviews.Content: stayed Oct 24th-28th Comfortable, inviting, warm not only describes the hotel itself, but the staff as well. The best thing we did for our vacation was book this splendid hotel. The area is definitly safe and quiet while being just steps from the hustle and bustle of the famed Champs Elysees Boulevard, as well as the metro ,which is the best point of departure for .... everywhere! I believe it is also easy accessible to and from the airport, as you dont cross the city, but rather use the nearby highway. (My viewpoint) The room was beautiful, clean, about 20 sq. meters, (perfect) the bathroom was quite comfortable and always had hot water and heat. Cleaned twice a day, evening choclates left on our pillows . CNN, CNBC available on tv. Breakfast wonderful, all kinds of breads, fruits, cereals, cold cuts, yogurt, tomatos, cucumbers, juices buffet style in very nice enviornment. Very friendly service at both breakfast and night in bar for coffee or drinks. We are planning for Paris again, sometime next year, but only if we can book at this hotel otherwise, vacation will have to wait until they have an available room!!!

Reviews.Title: “My absolute favorite place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NeSuedois
Reviews.Content: My absolute favorite place to stay in Paris. I have been to the City of Lights more than 100 times over the past 30+ years so I know what I am talking about. Have stayed at many different hotels over the years until I found Hotel Napoleon five or six years ago--and since then it has been my home when in Paris. Great location, nice rooms ( I typically stay in a Junior suite, although frequently that is a no-charge upgrade). I must say though that the Errol Flynn suite is about as good as it gets--stayed there once!! The people working at the hotel are extremely helpful, very professional and will do anything to make your stay a memorable event. The bar is a nice place to have a drink or a late eveing meal and again the service is top class.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be !”
Reviews.Author: BeijingWsch
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, unpretentious and helpful staff. Beautifully decorated rooms which are larger than average for Paris, and of course the fantastic location. Try to get a room on the 6th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower and L'Arc de Triumph. Honestly, one of the best places we've stayed in Paris, at a reasonable price. Even our two teenage kids were impressed ! Don't change please !

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service and Amenities!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GoGators21
Reviews.Content: We had the most AMAZING experience at Hotel Napoleon! From the time we were greeted at the entrance on Sunday morning to the time we left Wednesday afternoon, we were thoroughly impressed. My wife and I stayed at Hotel Napoleon for 3 nights during the first half of a Paris/London vacation. When we arrived, the front desk immediately wished my wife a very happy birthday and offered us a complimentary upgrade from a Classic room to a Junior Suite. The Junior Suite, located on the fifth floor, was like our own little Parisian apartment, complete with a separate living area, king sized bed, and a beautiful and spacious bathroom (a rare find in Paris!). The suite had two full-length glass windows that opened up to Avenue de Friedland and also provided a view of the Eiffel Tower in the distance (which was quite beautiful to look at from our balcony as it sparkled during the night. The interior of the room was very clean, and the service was top-notch. The location is perfect for anyone experiencing Paris for the first time. Just steps away from the Arc de Triumphe and the Champs Elysees, and only about 100 yards from a well-connected Metro station. The only downside was that the hotel was so nice, it was a struggle trying to get my wife to leave the room! =)

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Alex789
Reviews.Content: Great room, very nice decor, very french. I got a great price on the hotel web page.(special)......The only problem construction going on, so forget about naping in the afternoon, the noices from 9am to 5pm were LOUD. Hotels in old buildings have the same problems, continuous renovations so check before you book. expensive breakfast. Excellent location but pricy

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Napoleon Was Great”
Reviews.Author: MidlothianVAFamily
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Napoleon in a Suite & had a great time. It was close to the Metro and the arch de Triomphe. The rooms were great and cleaned daily with fresh towels. A private bathroom was good with two sinks and a bathtub with shower as well as bidet and toilet. It was not home but got good critical reviews from my wife. I would stay there again. Note: we did not see any kids there. English is spoken well & front desk staff is helpful. We did not find this in the books and I wonder why.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: eppingjetta
Reviews.Content: We arrived early for our stay, to find our room already ready. The bellhop took our bags to the room while we checked in, and then showed us the room. Fantastic. Our room looked exactly like it did on the website. Every detail was as French as two honeymooning tourists could ask for. The bellhop showed us how to operate the shower, the safe, and the lights. He even grabbed a bunch of literature about the what the hot attractions in Paris are and what events were happening, all in english. The room service was fast and the food was great! We had room service several times, and although the price was high, the quality of the food was by far the best we had the whole trip. I highly recommend ordering entrees from the room service menu(the lamb was the best I've ever had!) And the desserts were small, but to die for. The bar even stayed open late one night for us and let us order drinks after they were closed. We graciously tipped the bar tender, who made us feel like we were the most important people in the world. The staff was extremely helpful. Every day they cleaned the room for us, and at night(if we were out), would come in and turn down the bed, leaving mints for us and closing the curtains. The whole staff spoke great english, and didn't mind us when we attempted to speak mutilated french. They mailed letters and post cards for us, and were happy to give us directions, addresses, and travel advice for anywhere in the city. The room itself had a great view of the Arc and the surrounding streets, a small balcony as promised, and one of the nicest little bathroom we've ever had in a hotel. The hot water lasted forever, and the tub was just big enough for two comfortably and there were new clean towels everyday. The hotel also sits right on a major subway station, Charles De Gaulle Etoile. From there you can access almost any subway in Paris and get wherever you want to go in only a few stops. I loved this hotel, and I highly recommend it. I could have stayed forever and was sad to have to leave. Hotel Napoleon surpassed all expectations and I would be honored to stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: lovelyParis
Reviews.Content: In a world full of hotels which are becoming more and more like railway stations : cold,impersonal and devoid of personality ; what a joy to find a " home away from home " hotel ! The " Napoleon " , situated almost at the foot of the "Arc-de-Triomphe",in the exclusive VIIIeme arrondissement is a warm , elegant and beautifully furnished hotel . It has the charm and lovely taste of a French home . The staff , from bellboys to receptionists and from waiters to chambermaids are without exception friendly smiling and very helpful . We appreciated being walking distance from all the boutiques , shops and even the Eiffel Tower ! My family and myself thoroughly enjoyed all our stays at the " Napoleon " and are looking forward to our next stay there !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ...Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: aziz2008
Reviews.Content: 2nd time in Paris. Excellent location neare the famous street. the staff was very helpfull. the negative comments : the coredors was very narrow but this was not obstacle. bathroom : there was a leak and the floor was floded but the staff fixed it immediately and this is approve that they are care with their customeres. the near building was under repair. as a general I recomend this hotel to be as a one of paris options.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay...great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris0274
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the 16th Aug for 2 nights, just 50mtrs from Charles De Gaulle Etoile Metro so very handy for getting around Paris. Hotel is in a great location just by the Arc de Triomphe and 1 block from the Champs Elysees. All Staff that we came across were very friendly. We were booked into a Deluxe room. 308. Room was large, bed was very comfortable, wallpaper was a little tired & the bathroom needs a bit of a refurb (not that shown on the hotels own web). Shocked to find no iron or ironing board in the room & was told this could not be delivered as there was a room on the 1st floor to goto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: moorishidol
Reviews.Content: This was booked for my 30th Birthday and was a brilliant suprise! You really can't fault the location, a stones throw from the Arc De Triomph, and the hotel is on the road directly behind the Champs Elysee. The view from the balcony of the room - A panoramic View Room, was one of the best in Paris, a view of the Eiffel Tower, which was amazing to see at night when the tower is all lit up. So easy to catch the red open top tourist bus from the top of the Champ Elysee opposite the Arc, and jump on and off to explore Paris. There is also a metro station just over the road from the bus stop so transport is a great plus when staying at this hotel. But you do have more than a couple of Paris's attractions on your doorstep if you stay at this hotel, I would recommend walking down the Champs Elysee and having a wander around first, its not far from the Eiffel Tower, or the Siene. Perfectly do-able after dinner at the Eiffel Tower and a leisurely walk back stopping in a few cafes for a glass of wine or ten! The service in the hotel was of a high standard, and when you walk it it certainly give you the feel of being in Paris. It had all the decor of being in an elegant french hotel - and was exactly that! The room itself was huge, with a massive bed and a sofa, mini bar, desk and flat screen tv. There was a table and chairs on the balcony to admire the view. There was ample wardrobe space and a safe for valuables. The bathroom was large - but a little quirky - the shower didn't reach far enough over the batch to wash with ease - but you can sit on the edge of the batch against the wall and have a rest while you shower! It certainly didn't put me off, it just added to the charm. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom and slippers and robes, all little extra touches to make you feel comfortable, inlcuding the chocolates on your pillow. All aspects of the hotel were spotless, and I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are treating a loved one, or for a really romantic weekend break or as a special birthday present.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mckees
Reviews.Content: 2nd time in Paris. This is a great location...walk to many locations..public transit easy...lovely hotel...old world charm modernized with taste..room was big with pullout for our teen(which was the best pullout we have ever had in a hotel) and we had 2 sets of windows with lots of light and view of the street with beautiful window boxes of flowers...breakfast was superb and the music they played was fabulous..mix of old and new...staff was accommodating..business center was not working but front desk offered their own computer...would recommend to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss the experience”
Reviews.Author: ozee
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect (few meters away from the famous Arc de Triomphe and the Avenue des Champs Elysees and the entrance of the famous Charles Du Goules underground station). Staff were very friendly, room spacious and all rennovated with excellent toilets and showers. LCD tv's, excellent decoration, two elevators, high ceiling (the highest in Paris I guess). Overall experience: The best hotel I ever visited in Paris (I have been to paris more than 20 times in the past 10 years). Do not miss the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleLovesTrvling
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Napoleon. This time we stayed in The Errol Flynn Suite on the top floor. It's a huge suite, with 2 bedrooms and a living room(fold out couch, too), 2 bathrooms and a wrap around balcony with views of The Eiffel Tower and The Arc de Triomphe. During our last stay we had 2 (very large) jr suites. There was a glass wall between them that we were able to open up to make the rooms adjoining. The staff at the hotel are friendly and (most) speak French and English. You really can't beat the location (right beside the Arc de triomphe, Champs Elysees, The Metro and The RER (Charles de Gaulle-Etoile Station). The hotel has a/c which can be rare in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: VTI
Reviews.Content: My first choice was Hotel frontenac but my travel agent advised me this hotel. Very tasty french breakfast, small but clean and handy room (I stayed in a standart room) . 1 mn to champs elysees, .5 mn to metro station. Crew is smiling to you all the time, hard to find in france... I recommend this Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay”
Reviews.Author: MrandDrJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superb, and we had a lovely stay. Especially impressed with the price we paid through Expedia, as I have had indifferent experiences in Paris hotels for the same sort of money in the past. I was amused to read other reviewers' comments on this hotel, especially from those who simply equate quality with size ... the rooms are not enormous but by Paris standards they are more than generous, certainly more than big enough for my friend and I to feel comfortable in our twin room. Everything was spotlessly clean, and the beds superbly comfortable. Magazines in English had been left in our room prior to our stay. The desk staff were helpful and spoke good English. The breakfast is expensive, but we were allowed a discount for one breakfast so took breakfast there once, which was excellent .. the other two mornings there was no problem finding a cafe, although if you're doing the same, I'd advise that you avoid the cafe nearly opposite which was expensive for poor-quality pastries, and head on to the Champs Elysees instead. The very best thing about this hotel is its location: two minutes from the metro at the Arc de Triomphe, I have never stayed so centrally in Paris and it was marvellous. My only word of warning: we decided to treat ourselves to a taxi back to Charles de Galle airport and asked the front desk to book it for us, which they happily did. However, I luckily checked with them what the price would be, and was calmly informed "around 120 euros"!!!! Needless to say, we cancelled ... a taxi to the airport isn't cheap from central Paris but it shouldn't cost that. In reality, the journey by RER railway from just nearby is easy and quick.

Reviews.Title: “a real palace in the heart i of Paris”
Reviews.Author: adista
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the outstanding suite room 603 was perfect. This is the right adress for a top quality stay in the heart of PARIS just off Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomph. The hotel offers a unique and true palace experience stay - the staff is outstandingly nice and professional. Breakfast was awesome- and sitting close to the window overlooking a nice patio with a small garden downstairs was truly rewarding. I would rate it 5 stars and rates are reasonable taking into consideration the ample size of the rooms, the atmosphere' quality of service and the unique "PARIS EXPERIENCE"' not offered by any peer top class- "mass" hotel. Ruth and Adi Sternberg

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Napoleon - Old world charm with modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: GJR2008
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Napoleon was everything you think it might be when you look at the web site, and if you like spending time in the hotel, you will love the Napleon. It was in a beautiful neighborhood and steps from the Arc de Triomphe and the metro. We booked a "Deluxe Panoramic Room" on the Napoleon web site (the best rate we could find at the time). It was very expensive (310 Euro per night), but in the end we felt like it was worth it, especially if you don't think you'll get to Paris again. There were no surprises with the rate and no hidden fees; however, nothing else was included in the rate.....no breakfast, no internet (we paid 19.99 Euro per 24 hours, but the connection worked very well). The hotel lobby, hallways and room were beautiful....just what you'd want in Paris. We had a corner room on the 5th floor and could see the top of the Eiffel Tower and the Arc (at an angle) from our room. The room was very spacious and felt like a little apartment because it had a small foyer when you walked in and opened up to a sitting area with a desk near the king sized bed and a large armoire. The room was furnished with old world charm, but the bathroom was moden, spacious with double sink, had a great hair dryer and plenty of room to unpack to make you feel at home. The only complaint would be that the glass shower door wasn't long enough so water sprayed on the floor (seems to be a European thing). We also loved the separate toilet area with it's own sink. We enjoyed the hotel restaurant....very cozy...and thought the burgers were among the best we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Napoleon is still Victorious :-)”
Reviews.Author: OandG
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantasic hotel can't say enough good things. We have stayed in hotels all around the world and enjoyed this one best. In a scale of cost this one was mid range but top on everything else.. Location couldn't get better, Style not ultra modern but very classy with quality in every aspect from lobby to even the budget room. But perhaps the best thing about the hotel if the above doesn't convince you is the staff... very friendly and cant help enough, The atmosphere alone makes for an incredible stay at this hotel. House keeping even come in in the evening when you've went out and they replace the towels turn down the sheets and leave a wee sweety on your pillow! Dont even look anywhere else, book this one.

Reviews.Title: “Was brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: viscounts
Reviews.Content: Just went there to stay the one night in the hotel. It is right in the center and very handy to see all the sights. Inside the people speak very good English and are very helpful. Very nice staff and the rooms are incredible. I think that the style is not so modern which is nice. In my opinion, for its location, feel and everything else that one wants in a romantic hotel stay-the best in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a "Gem"”
Reviews.Author: hypnos001
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location, right off the Champs Elysees and a few meters from the nearest subway station. The staff is attentive and very professional in a friendly and effective way. The room was impeccably set, and the room service rapid and courteous, The restaurant (we had lunch) was exquisite, food presentation is excellent and creative, and the magret was very tasty. Here again the staff is superb, attentive but discreet. Overall a first class experience, right in the heart of Paris. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “great family stay”
Reviews.Author: kfc917
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed in "junior suite" for 4 nights in June 2008 . It was perfect set up for a family of three. We had a king sized bed in a large room for my husband and me and a double convertible bed for our 15 year old son. Sliding pocket doors divided the bedroom from the living room for quiet & privacy. (the photos on the hotels website - are acurate). Lovely marble bathroom with all the trimmings. We faced on to the courtyard with red geraniums in all the window boxes. Great air conditioning - we even needed extra blankets. Location great - two blocks from the Metro & one from the Champs Elysee. Concierege & all the staff very friendly & helpful. Only one current drawback is construction on the adjoining building. - Fortunately they don't work on weekends & don't start til 8 am. - If you are a light sleeper ask not to be on the courtyard and you won't even be aware of the site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Napoleon Paris!”
Reviews.Author: vgtx
Reviews.Content: For the past 4 years we have stayed at least once a year in the Hotel Napoleon Paris. We've enjoyed the service, the location and the delicious chocolates they put on the bed every night. The restaurant has excellent food and the breakfast buffett is very good. We have no complaints at all, strongly recommend the stay !

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPHS
Reviews.Content: I appreciated a lot my stay in the hotel: the main reason is that all the staff was extremely friendly, which is quite a surprise for an hotel at this touristic location. This changes a lot from nearby hotels I stayed for business purpose where the staff is often lazy and obsequious. That's very pleasant to be in a place where people are here to make you feel good. I stayed there with my wife and baby girl for 1 week and we were given a very big room with two big windows (it was a deluxe). It was quiet, even with opened windows. The room was correctly decorated, with antics-like furniture. The bathroom was big and clean but not so nice. The cafe, with outdoor space, was also a pleasant place to have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “A Rewarding Experience”
Reviews.Author: eugen18
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to experience a cosy hotel in Paris, then hotel Napoleon is the first choice. It was mid May and we had a Junior Suite on the first floor. Breathtaking view to L'Arc de Tromphe, a very nice terace with little green trees and beautiful flowers, we enjoyed that both at sunrise and at sunset. That gave us an unparalel feeling of well beeing savouring a glass of wine and unwind after a busy day on the nice terace. The bedroom and the living room, quite large gave us a warm and fussy sensation just at the first glance, then let us relax in the deep, soft couch, with a touch of old, but refined furniture. A special note for the bathroom, fully equiped with anything we need. The concierge and front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, providing all kind of assistance in booking tours of Paris and its atractions. The hotel is just around the corner of Champs- Elysees, so whenever we needed some action, just walked for three minutes and we were there. Also it is minutes away from the underground metro station. Overall, it was a rewarding experience for us and we are looking forward to come back to the Napoleon hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: brebut
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION-Staff very friendly and helpful. Prices are very high(i.e coffee in room $9.00 per serving) although food in room reasonable.Hotel needs a renovation in some areas but overall very nice.We would would not hestitate to stay there again and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Ces't Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: tennrg
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world about 35 weeks a year and pride myself on staying in the finest hotels. I would rate Hotel Napolean at the very top of my stays, for many reasons. Beginning at reception and concierge, you are welcomed as if a member of their family. Housekeeping makes one feel as if you're in your own home, The Bivouc and the room service people are outstanding as is the quality of the food. Throughout the building you can see photographs of the famous people who used to live and stay at Hotel Napolean, which adds to the comfort of their great beds, sheets, robes, amentities. As I say, it rates at the top. The only fault is I think they need to replace the carpeting on the stairs, looks worn, but that may be to show how busy they are! Five stars in my book and I will always return there.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: Khaled-Asta
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful hotel and feels like home....the staff are extremely friendly and nice... it is a great a choice..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Napoleon!!!”
Reviews.Author: ggvir
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Napoleon for five nights and loved it! We were in a Deluxe Panoramic view room and it was spacious, clean and comfortable. It had a sitting area and we had a garden terrace that we could eat our meals on. It was wonderful! The bathroom was modern and beautiful. The room was tastefully decorated and was very Parisian. Probably the best part about the Hotel was its courteous staff. They could speak English and were helpful and polite. The concierge was extremely helpful and was able to get us last minute tickets on two seperate occasions. He was also ready with an umbrella when were going out to dinner and it was raining. Room service was quick and the food was very good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlowgirlVancouver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both loved this hotel. It was one of 4 we stayed at in Europe over a 2 week period and was definately the best. The staff could not have been nicer. They greeeted us each time as we left and returned to the hotel. They were so kind as I tried to speak French. Our room was quiet even though it faced the street which we had requested. We had a nice view of the trees and beautiful flower boxes. The room was a good size and lovely with high windows and a very comfortable bed. The location was perfect, safe and very close to a subway entrance. Marlene Peters Vancouver BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsBob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated two minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe. The service is excellent and all speak English. The room was spotless and well appointed The Napoleon theme is throughout the hotel and is fascinating. All of the decor is very tasteful The staff could not have been more helpful. The breakfast was top class I could not find fault with this hotel. The weekend was delightful and everything was excellent. We have stayed in many hotels in Paris but none as good as this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelerHongKong
Reviews.Content: I took my son to Paris for a weekend break and I booked this hotel which I knew from previous experience, though I had not been there for some years. I got a very good deal from booking the hotel directly on the hotel website. I found the hotel lived up perfectly to our expectations. It is very well furnished and decorated, in typical Parisian style and with typical Parisian charm. The room had all the amenities we expected from a hotel of this class. The staff were excellent, very professional and providing genuinely sincere and friendly service. My son loved the quality, variety and quantity of the buffet breakfast. I would recommend this hotel without reservation to anyone looking for a perfectly located, mid-price hotel in the very heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: Thankfully this was a wonderful hotel. I had been very apprehensive about our stay after reading the latest reviews. However, we had a great experience. The lobby was fantastic, with a beautiful fireplace. The bellman was great, offering very nicely to help us to our room with our huge amounts of luggage. Our room surpassed our expectations. We had a corner room with one window facing the Eiffel Tower and the other window facing the Arc. We had a little sitting area, a coffee maker and a writing desk, along with a large bed--it was very quaint. Yes, the rooms are dated. They are supposed to be—they are filled with antiques. And, yes, it could be a little cleaner and updated, but we loved it. I hated to leave. Our next rip to Paris will definitely include the Napoleon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris !”
Reviews.Author: Juliet65
Reviews.Content: My Grand-daughter, daughter and myself stayed in the Lovely Napoleon Hotel last week-end, We were thrilled with the panoramic room looking onto the Eiffel Tower.To see it sparkling just before bed-time was exciting.. The food was excellent. My grand-daughter and I had breakfast in the room c'est tres bonne.The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff were friendly and helpful ,and spoke English. I would certainly book again. Juliet Whyte,Macduff Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wildmandxb
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a travel agent in Dubai not knowing anything about it...I heard a lot of bad reviews about 4 star hotels in Paris, however, this hotel is excellent! It is ideally located on the Champs-elysee, the service is perfect, the staff are really friendly and they do not get hostile if you don't speak french!!! they actually great you in English as soon as you step into their doorway, although i am a french speaker i found that highly professional. Room service was impeccable, we never had to ask them to clean our room, check-in and check-out were very efficient. The hotel itself doesn't have that much amenities/entertainment, however we went to paris to enjoy the city and not the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to every one wanting a relaxed accomodation in paris. The cost is average -French standards.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: alejandro0809
Reviews.Content: Back home I only want to thank you for the marvelous time we spent in Paris, I want to thank you all kindness you provided to me and my family, thanks to all hotel staff, for the lovely suite provided, decoration, the view to Friedland and the Triumph Arc, we realy enjoyed it specialy after a day walking around this beatiful city, the relaxation of the bath tub, the size of the bathroom!! and the very well lighted, many things in our memories. Now we understand why people preffers your hotel which was highly recommended. No objection at all everything was perfect. People at reception while we checked in, so smily so friendly, what to say about the restaurant and bar, we never felt as tourists but at home, we returned home relaxed and happy, but let me tell you it was not easy to leave you !! Hope in the nearest future we will have the opportunity to lodge with you again Our thankfullnes Alejandro Sanchez Ramirez and family

Reviews.Title: “Not so great...”
Reviews.Author: PVmomLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: So-so hotel with rude staff. We were celebrating very special occasion, but were still put in room facing scaffolding from construction next door. When we asked the concierge for a resteraunt reccomendation, he refered us to one two blocks away. When we got there there place was boarded up with grafitti on it. Hmmm...not great service. The rooms were fine though. Moved after 3 nights to a wonderful hotel near the Louvre. Much better service and location!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hotel for Americans”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkieca
Reviews.Content: Things in Paris are expensive but no one should pay $300 per night for a hotel as run down as this. I had read several reviews of this hotel before leaving and became concerned and therefore wrote to the hotel The manager wrote back and assured me that the reviews were from disgruntled people who wanted discounts and offered to upgrade me. She was charming but also told me she would be out of town while I stayed there. The room was not an upgrade and at best a very low three star room. It was clean,very clean but the wallpaper was old and coming off the bottom, the bathroom, although redone had a painted plywood ceiling. This was Room 509. That would have been okay for me as I was only staying one night and then meeting friends and moving into a Paris apartment. However, I had a very bad adventure which the Napoleon made worse. Upon arriving, they ushered me to my room immediately (at 9:00 a.m.); this was great. I took a nap and at 1 p.m. I went out to go to Poulaine, my favorite bakery, to buy bread. I had always ridden the metro so had no trouble doing it again. Upon my return, I was about to exit Charles DeGaulle/Etiole metro station but hestitated because I wanted to find the exit closest to the hotel. I sat down, looked at my map, found it and began to exit up the steep escalator. At the top a young man bent over and prevented me from getting off. When I tried to jump over him, the man behind me grabbed me by the back of my coat and slammed me into the subway wall three times, knocked the wind out of me; I fell to the floor where he kicked me, reached into my pockets and stole all my credit cards and money. I yelled "Policer, policer," but no one came and the passersby just looked at me funny and kept walking. I pulled myself together and went to the hotel. I went to the front desk and told them what happened and asked them to call the police. They said the police don't come out for this kind of thing but that I could walk to the polcie station a few blocks away. It was getting dark and I wasn't venturing outside again. Then I explained that they had stolen all my credit cards and money. They jumped into action. They got the copy of my passport and credit card they had taken on check in and immediately charged my room to the credit card. "Now that we have charged your room, here is a number to call to cancel your card." I was little stunned. I stayed at the desk and called Bank of America and Citibank while the various front desk people watched. No one offered me any consolation except for a nice young man who told me he had lived in North Africa and had seen these things happen a number of times there but not in Paris. He said I was lucky the man did not use a knife. My business concluded, I went to my room. The next morning I called and explained that I was having money wired to me on that day but that I didn't have money for breakfast or coffee and could they see fit to send me breakfast or coffee and I promised I would pay for it as soon as Western Union wired me the money (which was supposed to be by 2 p.m. Paris time). NO. I had not eaten since New York where I changed planes and also hadn't had anything to drink. NO. I called theree or four times and finally a bellboy brought me a cup of black coffee and put his finger to his lips as if to say, "don't tell anyone". I was outraged by the inhumanity of the entire thing. They were kind enough to accept my new credit card when it arrived on Wednesday and called me at the apartment to pick it up. But, on Sunday, the man behind the desk made me write a letter authorizing them to accept the card. Upon check out they argued with me over 6 euros for phone calls I made to the credit card companies but eventually forgave that. I grabbed a cab to the apartment as I had left 10 euro in the hotel room before being mugged. It was not enough. Luckily, the cab driver was nicer than the people at this hotel and gave me the ride for 10 euro. NEVER STAY HERE IF YOU ARE AMERICAN. I DON'T THINK THE PEOPLE WHO WORK THERE CARE VERY MUCH FOR AMERICANS. OR, THEY ARE ALL JUST VERY COLD. $300? God, no. Not even worth $90. It's a Motel 6 on a bad day. Stay as far away as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: noadsie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at this excellent Hotel. We booked direct through the hotels web site and got one of the Panoramic rooms with a view of the Arc. The room was very large with a huge bed (basically two single divans). Also had table couple of chairs and settee. Reception staff spoke good English (as you would expect in a 4* hotel) and arranged taxi's that arrived exactly on schedule. Location is about a one minute walk from the Arc, but it does mean you are at one end of the sights rather than in the middle. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Naploleon Was A Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: LJANEGRAY
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel directly to make a reservation one week prior to my stay, at which time, they neglected to mention that there was construction going on in the hotel and the building beside them is being demolited. During the day, there is a constant sound of jack hammering, hope you like being up at 6 am. The housekeeping attempt was spotty, most of us like a clean bathroom. The location was great. The hotel staff were extremely rude and unhelpful, if you want a drink in the lounge go when your not thirsty because by the time you are you might get served. The front desk staff were unhelpful and relied on the fact that they could use the french/english language barrier as a crutch. I would never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to a dog. This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member

Reviews.Title: “Very Enojyable, great staff - - Loved the Fren Martinis”
Reviews.Author: fdj007
Reviews.Content: If there was a rating for 4 and a half, it would have actually recieved this - it is an excellent as a place to stay as any 4 star I have stayed in, but not quite a 5 out of 5. I found the rooms to be clean, large (for a capital city hotel) and very well kept. The hotel it self although more boutique than palatial was very smart and had a sense of sophistication. Location was superb, the staff very friendly, and price a bargain in comparison to its main rivals in the locale. the only down points are (as stated in several reviews) are the rooms are very warm at night with very poor air con. We had to leave our windows open in the day to cool the room down - as the air con did not work properly. Also beware of the rip off brasseries along the champs elyssee, close to the hotel. 50 Euros for a petit de jeneur? Walk a few hundred yards behind the hotel instead (but this really is not the hotels fault - but if they provided a better and cheaper alternative that would be good). All in all we spent 400 Euros for a supior romm for a two person and two night stay - and in retrospect it was worth every penny. You can spend that for a single night in a Parisian hotel - and your experience will not be half as good. BOOK NOW, YOU WILL LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: WRC219
Reviews.Content: We recently (9/17-20/07) visited Paris for the first time and loved the city. We stayed at the Hotel Napoleon, a VERY nice smaller hotel with a GREAT location! It was about 1 block from the Arc de Triomphe and it was the next street over from the Champs Elysees. The staff was very accomodating and helpful and made up for my feeble attempts at speaking French by being fluent in English. The hotel served a nice breakfast buffet - that was offered at a discounted price for any one booking through Expedia. The bar/lounge was a nice place to relax after a day of sightseeing. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again, and I would highly recommend the Hotel Napoleon to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Taniquan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a solid 4 star hotel in a great location at the foot of the Arch of Triumph right at the end of the Champs Elysees. The hotel lobby, rooms and service is a sold 4 stars. I did not eat there so I cannot say how the food is. If I had to complain it would be that the king bed I ordered was in fact two twins put together so if you slept in the middle you tended to separate them. Another plus is that it also across the street from the metro. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Now that I just read some of the recent reviews here on this hotel I can see how different people have different experiences and different expectations. My room was small too but so are all the rooms in Paris but not as small as those in London. And the room I got had a great view. So my position that this is a great hotels stands.

Reviews.Title: “Awufl Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SPC1105
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment this hotel was. Great location, right next to the Arc de Triomphe and a metro station only 50 metres away but what a rip off. The rooms were small and dark. The bathroom was tiny and the shower didn't work properly. We stayed in a superior room which was nothing like the pictures on the website. The staff, apart from one person at the front desk, were rude and unhelpful. The bar shut early and even when it was open the food and drinks were totally overpriced. Our room was booked through Expedia so was cheaper than the website, but still totally overprice. This is a hotel that is living off a reputation from 10 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: danpool
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived till the time we checked out, we could not have enjoyed ourselves more. The staff was knowledgeable and attentive and the location was great. We upgraded our room and had a view of the Eiffel Tower out one window and the Arc de Triumph out the other window. Hotel was very close to one of the main Metro stations so getting around was simple. Clean room was well appointed and bigger than I expected it to be. Would recommend to all and will stay there again the next trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: stefhef
Reviews.Content: We booked a jr. suite; were told it would have a king and 2 twins. It had a queen and a couch made into a bed and a tiny cot. Also told we would face the street. We faced an interior courtyard. The place needs upgrading. Bathroom was ok. We checked out the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Bliss”
Reviews.Author: lesm1
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough nice things about this hotel. It was my second visit. This time we had a panoramic suite on the top floor for new year's eve. The view was absolutely incredible. We had a balcony that wrapped around the entire room. The room was in perfect Paris style. After staying in this type of room, it would be very hard to return and stay in a standard small room. The staff even had little bottles of complementary champagne for us to ring in the new year. The concierge was great, handling all my restaurant reservation requests throughout the city, which really saved me time and a huge headache.
